name: robot models
status: A living document of anthropomorphised toys.

hardware.feature: 43 degrees of freedom; 3D LiDAR and depth cameras; magnetic joint covers for modularity; walking speed up to 2 m/s; 2-hour battery runtime.
Integrated self-driving AI for navigation; 40+ degrees of freedom; dual-arm manipulation; 360-degree vision with 12 cameras; 5-hour battery with hot-swap.
Tactile sensors on hands and torso; 28 degrees of freedom; force-torque feedback in joints; Ethernet and Wi-Fi connectivity; 4-hour industrial runtime.
Modular arm design for tool swapping; RGB-D cameras for depth perception; collaborative safety features; payload capacity 5 kg per arm; 3-hour battery.
Multimodal AI for voice/gesture recognition; 5G connectivity; flexible spine with 6 DoF; emotional expression via facial actuators; 6-hour home-use battery.
Next-gen vision system: 2x frame rate, 1/4 latency, 60% wider FOV per camera; embedded palm cameras for <20ms grasp feedback; Helix AI for on-board reasoning.
Fully electric actuators with modular high-torque motors; embedded 3D vision for <30ms dynamic response; drops hydraulics for quieter, efficient control.
Swarm coordination via 5G-A low-latency networks; AI-driven locomotion/vision software for <40ms sync in multi-robot setups.
Google's Gemini Robotics AI integration for edge inference; low-latency joint torque feedback for heavy-lift tasks; 1M-token context for planning.
Vision-language-action models with <50ms end-to-end latency; frameless motors for precise, low-inertia grasping; battery runtime 4-8 hours.
Novel end-to-end neural network for continuous real-time adaptation and optimization of movements; shockingly realistic walking gait.
Robust bipedal gait adapting to varying surfaces and obstacles; engineered for speed and precision in warehouse tasks.
Bipedal design with low-latency teleop traces for skill learning; NVIDIA Isaac GR00T N1 for on-board autonomous execution.
High walking speed with modular upgrades; 3D LiDAR and depth cameras for sharp environmental awareness.
Targeting mass production with advanced bipedal mobility for healthcare and rehab tasks.
AI-powered for walking, object manipulation, and communication; flexible silicone skin for 12+ emotions; 6-hour battery with 77% Russian components.

models.use_cases: On-board execution for manipulation; used in NEO Gamma for tidying.
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: TENNs algorithm for FPGA/low-power; Isaac platform optimizations.

models.use_cases: Manipulation, voice interaction; fine-tuned for skill chaining in bipeds.
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: INT8 quantization, on-device fine-tuning; runs on single GPU/CPU.
models.notes_sources: Used in hybrid LLM-RL pipelines for adaptive grasping.

performance.platform: Intel Core i7-12700K, 32GB RAM, Ubuntu 22.04, ONNX Runtime INT8
performance.notes: Tested with quantized model; matches official ONNX benchmarks.

models.use_cases: Navigation & planning; low-level control in unpredictable environments.
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: Structured sparsity (2:4), KV-cache quantization; Minstrel framework for edge balance.
models.notes_sources: Ideal for real-time RAG in robots.

performance.notes: Benchmark: time-to-first-token under 60ms, 170 tokens/sec throughput. Batch size 1. Suits real-time control.

performance.platform: Apple M2 Pro, macOS Sonoma, 16GB RAM, vLLM
performance.notes: Edge deployment; throughput ~130 tokens/sec, TTFT ~95ms. Instruct-tuned variant, fast for navigation tasks.

models.use_cases: Agentic coding for robot behaviors; multimodal (vision+text) for scene understanding.
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: MoE (Mixture-of-Experts) for sparse activation; on-device tool-calling.
models.notes_sources: Excels in long-horizon tasks like tidying.

performance.notes: Benchmarked with MoE active; excelling in multimodal, on-board pipelines.

models.use_cases: 3D perception & reasoning in autonomous driving/robots (e.g., LiteVLM pipeline).
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: Speculative decoding + patch selection; optimized for embedded VLMs.
models.notes_sources: Open-weight; crushes math/reasoning benchmarks; low-power for battery-constrained bots.

performance.notes: Speculative decoding enabled; real-time tested in simulators.

models.use_cases: Embodied navigation; multi-modal fusion for human-robot interaction.
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: W4A16 weight-only quantization; TensorRT-LLM integration for edge.
models.notes_sources: Massive context (10M tokens) for planning; deployed in Figure 03 for warehouse tasks.

performance.notes: Quantized to int4; multi-modal fast inference, tested in robotics warehouse setting.
Quantized to int4; edge CPU deployment, throughput ~11 tokens/sec.

models.use_cases: Voice-based locomotion; hybrid cloud-edge for Apollo/Optimus.
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: On-device distillation; Gemini Robotics AI for edge inference.
models.notes_sources: Lightweight VLM variant; strong in video understanding for dynamic environments.

performance.notes: Quantized for fast edge inference; tested in voice/vision pipeline.
Batch size 1, real-world robotics; context window 128k tokens.

models.use_cases: Real-time behavior trees; LLM-BRAIn for fast robot planning.
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: 95% context reduction; speculative decoding for function calling.
models.notes_sources: Ideal for agentic systems in bipeds like SE01.

performance.notes: Latencies tested for fast function calling; function invocation ~0.36s vs. GPT-4 ~1s.

models.use_cases: Autonomous navigation; interpretable actions in Walker S2 swarms.
models.key_optimizations_for_low_latency: End-to-end VLM for driving; patch/token selection for camera feeds.
models.notes_sources: Robotics-specific; integrates with ROS for low-latency JSON action queries.
